column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=Ferment oil of Erica vulgaris.
#Text=The fresh herb is treated as
#Text=above, the distillate is cohobated and repeatedly distilled after
#Text=addition of common salt, then sliaken up with ether and the ether
#Text=carefully distilled off from the dissolved oil.
#Text=The oil is greenish-yellow, mobile, lighter than water, with a peculiar odour and sweet,
#Text=aromatic, huining taste.
#Text=It reddens litmus paper and burns with
#Text=a clear, blue-edged dame without leaving any residue.
#Text=Ferment oil of Marrubium vulgare.
#Text=The comminuted herb
#Text=is soaked in water and exposed to the sun, whereby it acquires an
#Text=offensive odour ; the liquid is then distilled, the distillate saturated
#Text=with common salt ; the flocks thereby separated are collected on a
#Text=filter and dissolved in ether and the ether slowly evaporated.
#Text=The
#Text=oil is lighter than water, has a peculiar sweet, ethereaT odour, and
#Text=an aromatic, slightly biting taste.
#Text=It burns without leaving any
#Text=residue, “With chlorine water it emits an odour of roses.
#Text=It
#Text=dissolves in aqueous alkalies and in water."
